edu.stanford.nlp.mt.base

Class Featurizable<TK,FV>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.mt.base.Featurizable<TK,FV>
  • Type Parameters:
    TK -
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DTUFeaturizable

    public class Featurizable<TK,FV>
extends Object
    Packages information about a newly constructed hypothesis for use by the incremental featurizers.
    Author:
    danielcer

      protected RawSequence<TK> partialTranslationRaw

      For a given sequence position in t2fAlignmentIndex or f2tAlignment, the index PHRASE_END is used to retrieve the end position of the aligned phrase.

      • hyp

        public final Hypothesis<TK,FV> hyp

      • partialTranslationRaw

        protected final RawSequence<TK> partialTranslationRaw
        While, internally, I want to be able to take advantage of the fact that partial translations are represented using RawSequence, I don't want to make that part of the API for people involved with writing features.

      • prior

        public final Featurizable<TK,FV> prior
        Featurizable associated with the partial hypothesis that was used to generate the current hypothesis. It is recommended that Featurizers that need to make use of internal state information as a hypothesis is being constructed maintain an internal Map from previously seen Featurizable objects to appropriate state objects.

      • PHRASE_START

        public static final int PHRASE_START
        For a given sequence position in t2fAlignmentIndex or f2tAlignment, the index PHRASE_START is used to retrieve the start position of the aligned phrase.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PHRASE_END

        public static final int PHRASE_END
        For a given sequence position in t2fAlignmentIndex or f2tAlignment, the index PHRASE_END is used to retrieve the end position of the aligned phrase.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • t2fAlignmentIndex

        public final int[][] t2fAlignmentIndex
        Partial translation to foreign sentence alignment index. By default, it is set to null. It is constructed only if any featurizer implements AlignmentFeaturizer. Guarantees that ranges corresponding to the same phrase are represented with the same int[] in order to allow '==' to be used over the ranges within a given index. For positions where no alignment exists, null is used.

      • f2tAlignmentIndex

        public final int[][] f2tAlignmentIndex
        Foreign sentence to partial translation alignment index. By default, it is set to null. It is constructed only if any featurizer implements AlignmentFeaturizer. Same guarantees as t2fAlignmentIndex
